title: [Large-Scale] Transgender Health Primary Care Integrated Education: Scientific Inquiry and Evidence-Based Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational medical knowledge and understanding of primary care procedures, basic concepts of scientific methodology (hypothesis formulation, experimental design, data analysis) and medical research design, and variable identification skills
context.additional_context: Project-Based Learning Using Digital Devices, with a Focus on Integrating Trans Health Knowledge into Existing Medical Systems. Developing Evidence-Based Care Models Through Experimental Design (Control Group Setup, Standardization of Measurement Tools) and Data Analysis. Emphasizing the Scientific Inquiry Process (Analysis and Conclusion Drawing) Through Multidisciplinary Collaboration

learning_goals: Enhancing competency in developing care plans reflecting physiological and psychological characteristics of transgender and nonbinary patients: customized approaches considering scientific observation and variable control

Developing case-based problem-solving skills by integrating transgender health knowledge into existing clinical protocols: Strengthening evidence analysis, data-driven decision-making, and interpretation of experimental results

Acquiring communication skills to respect the rights of transgender patients in multicultural settings: Applying scientific inquiry and ethical frameworks considering cultural contexts, and establishing intervention strategies based on observational data
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
